climbs.name: Time Tower (False Start)
climbs.fa: Pitch 1-Frank Nebbe, Renate Stockburger '87. Pitch 2- Unknown.

content.description:
Pitch 1- Free and aid to enter the wide crack.  Climb the wide or climb the thin crack to the right.  Continue up an interesting crack in a dihedral, to a roof, a pin, and then a mantel on to the notch. Two pin anchor.  5.8 C2 80'

Pitch 2-From the notch climb the obvious offwidth/chimney system to the top.  Once in the chimney go deep for a good hand crack.  Two pin anchor. 5.10 120'

Descent- Rappel from the top to the ground.  Or stop on top of pitch one.
content.protection: Double set from black alien to #6 camalot.  HB offsets.
content.location: Start the route on the southwest side of the tower.  Look up to see a pin near a small roof.

content.description:
Pitch 1- Climb up to a splitter crack in a shallow stem box.  Continue up on sandy rock past some offwidth to a big block that is more solid then it first looks.  Finish on the shoulder of Sand Hearse at a anchor. 5.11+ or 5.8 C1+ 100'

Pitch 2- From the anchor climb down and right onto the south face.  Climb a crack to the top and a two bolt anchor. 5.8

Variation- There appears to be a way to aid to the summit as well, by climbing directly above the anchor.

Descent-Rappel 165' off the North face to the ground.
content.protection: Singles of old 4.5 and 5 camalot. Doubles from green alien to #4 camalot. Stoppers.
content.location: Start the route on the northeast face of Sand Hearse.

climbs.name: North Marcher
climbs.fa: Leonard Coyne, Dennis Jackson, Stewart Green, Nov. 1979

content.description: Pitch one traverses onto a ledge on the SW side of the tower. Pitch 2 goes up an easy chimney, to 5.9 hands, then to 5.10+ OW and a 5.9 squeeze at the top.
content.protection: Outside of regular standard desert rack, bring the big stuff.  Lots of big stuff.  Bring your sac as well, for the climbing is bold.
content.location: Located in the remote NW corner of Arches.  This tower is the 2nd tower you come to.....(The Marching Men are all lined up in a row.)

climbs.name: Cuddlebunny Tower (Original Route)
climbs.fa: Charlie Fowler, Rob Slater and Geoff Tabin Â‘86

content.description:
This route climbs the southwest side of the formation via a continuous crack in the center of the face that leads directly to the summit anchors. You should be between CB and Sand Herse when you start.

Begin with 5.11 fingers and continue up the widening crack finishing with a 5.10 offwidth near the top. This route is easily aided at 5.9, C1+.

Descend with one two-rope rappel from solid pins on the summit to the base of the route.
content.protection: Two sets of cams from yellow Alien to 3.5 Camalot. A few extra in the 1-3" range and an optional bigger cam for the top.
content.location: As you're hiking in on the trail with the Marching Men on your left, Cuddlebunny is the third tower from the far end.

content.description:
The route starts on the Eastern side of the North face.  Climb over a bulge and up a loose dirty corner system to the top.  Gear anchor.

There was a lot of dirt on the lower bulge which had to be excavated to find the crack below.

Descent- Carefully simul-rappel off opposite sides of the tower.
content.protection: Single set of cams from green alien to #4 camalot.
content.location: The Bouquet is located next to the Tower Arch Trail in a wash to the west of the bluff North of Marching Men.
